text: Bevuto freddo (temperatura consigliata). Lintensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è considerevole. Laspetto del liquido è opalescente. Il corpo è rotondo, di struttura cremosa. Laroma alla lingua è molto dolce. Lacido è piacevolmente medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Il finale è astringente, lungo e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. Al palato sentori di yogurt e cocco.

Green glass bottle thanks to deft! Sampled on March 3, 2017. From teh gift shop at the "brewery". Marked XQ 2016.12.Thanks KyotoLefty for helping me ID this!Milky white color with grainy residue on the glass. Big chunk of gunk in the bottom of the bottle before shaking it. Alcohol, banana, fudge, butterscotch scent. Banana, grainy taste. Chalky, grainy, residue in the mouth and on the teeth. Alcohol, fruity aftertaste and finish.

Danke an Colin. Mild hefig alkoholischer Antrunk. Deutlich hefiger Antrunk, so trüb, dass sich die Trübung im wahrsten Sinne auf den Zähnen absetzt. Sehr süffig, mild fruchtig, Noten von Banane, etwas Mango. Sehr interessant! 10/9/10/9/13/9
turbio lechoso. Aroma láctico, ligero cítrico y plátano. Cuerpo sedoso con sabor como en aroma y final seco de trago cálido.
300ml bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $7.99 Not my favourite.
Milky yellow white. Citrus and plum aroma and taste with a little grain in the flavor. Hides the abv reasonably well.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours quity milky yellowish colour. Aroma of fresh medium intense fruity melons. Taste is very dry, strong melon notes, not to sweet, some alcohol, nice!

210ml cup from Sake Kontor Berlin. Milky in the glass, fresh and round typical Saké aroma in the nose. The Saké starts very smooth and mild. The milky rice is there, very smooth with fruity hints. Interesting aroma profile, that the rice there changes it to a smooth and creamy texture. Not too deep in the aftertaste, but refreshing with nice pears and melons there. Smooth milky-ricy aftertaste with a smooth and fruity melon-mild aftertaste. Very interesting and nice.

210ml green tinged ECO cup from Japan Centre online. Pours a milky white colour with no head and aroma of rice, light citric. Taste is rice, coconut milk, sweetish, pineapple, citrus, with hints of glue, paper, alcohol. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry sweetish finish. Quite OK.

Sweet and fruity. The sediment was different and did not help the beer, but it didnt take away from the taste; it was just different, but it made my tongue feel weird. This was purchased on clearance and I could see why.

Bottle. Off-white, cream color with substantial sediment. Citrus aroma with some coconut notes. Sweet citrus with some coconut notes. A lot of sediment in the body they distracts a bit from the taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - Milky and cheesy yeast notes. Turbid beige. Sweet dried pineapple, fruity and a dry finish. Not my cup of tea.

Bottle. Pours looking like skimmed milk. Pear, sweet rice, some slight Conor alcohol in the aroma. Flavor is mild, but slight sour fruit, sweet pear, and light fruits. Lighter soft body. Im a sake a noob but this drinks pretty good to me.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 (Bouteille): Des amandes affaiblies, des notes de lactose, de la sueur et quelques vapeurs dalcool. Assez docile sur lintensité des saveurs.

Bottle at home alongside a massive sushi platter. Pours cloudy, milky white. Aroma is fruity, sweet rice and light alcohol. Flavor is gritty sweet fruits and rice, light vanilla and alcohol with a sweet finish. Medium body.
Bottle. Hazy white and sweet. Some light fruot flavor. Thick with grit. Ok. Heavier palate than some.

300 ml bottle bought at ParkNShop Superstore in Fanling.
Cloudy, hazy coconut milky light beige colour mixed with lots of sake rice particles; Fragrant aroma of glutinous rice wine, with rich rice soup, mashed pear fresh, coconut milk, sugar, shredded coconut, fruity ester and alcohol; Medium sweet taste of sake rice, with strong glutinous rice soup, rice particles, moderate tartness, strong starch, pear puree, alcohol and sugar; Medium body, Thick and starchy rice palate; Mouth feel is like a rice porridge infused coconut milk. Sake tartness is very notable and the strongest Ive had so far for the style. Sweeteness is right-on medium, not cloying at all. Rice particles are coarse, more like having porridge, and with notable but never sharp booze more akin to a Winter Warmer, this is a bit messy but strangely appealing. I like it!... Wet after taste; Starchy and nicely sweet to mouth.

Comments: Once you have so many finely-grinded Nigoris, this is a whole new experience for enjoying the style - a look which resembles Summer coconut drink, coarse rice particles, rich starchy to the tongue, just right sweetness and smart tasty booze that wont knock you off. This is hearty and easily enjoyable. Recommended!

In the bottle, a milky white, separated. Shaken its a milky, yellowish-white concoction. The aroma is sweet light fruit, flowers, coconuts. The flavor is sweet fruit, coconut, rice. Not really boozy. Really "mushy" in mouthfeel, lots of particuates, like sand, or powder. Medium/thick in body. Sake is not my thing normally, but I enjoyed this. If I was a sake guy, I would probably be more entitled to an opinion, but I actaully liked this.

Bottle. Aroma is light rice, fruity plum, coconut. Flavor is similar with a very milky texture and a horchata-esque flavor. This is my first sake so Im not sure how the style or type of beverage is supposed to be. Not bad though.

30cl bottle - nigori is a French homonym with two distinct meanings: the idiot laughs or idiot rice (with inverted noun adjective agreement). pours like orxata minus the ice. Nose is rice, coconut and almonds. Flavor adds the mental image I have of the time my cat licked flee medicine from the back of her neck and made this comical yet energetic lapping noise with her tongue for a solid minute. Dry if not gritty. Can hardly detect the 10% ABV. Exotic to say the least perhaps due to the translucent green bottle and milky white liquid. stands out from all of the other sakes Ive had, hot or cold.

Hazy white colour, reminding of wall paper glue. Aroma of higher alcohols, nailpolish remover, acetone, glue with a hint of rice and tropical fruits. Sweet alcoholic flavour, rice. Quite rough, light sandy body, alcoholic finish.
Quite weird to drink, not entirely without its merits, but it just doesnt give the feeling of a quality product.
(From 30cL bottle @ ZZT VI. Courtesy of Countbeer. Thanks for sharing, Kamiel!)

Bottle @ Kiss The Kitchen Floor or better known as ZZT VI (2013): 
A hazy, no, its a murky muddy white looking sake with no head. Like cocos milk and Dutch Drebus sperm (so I was told...)
The aroma is bad: nail polish remover, amonia, cream, hint of rice (creamy rice part) and a light dusty note.
The flavours were pretty ok the first two gulps, but than, from the third gulp its getting harder to drink: dry mix of marzepin, warmth, alcohol, powder. The powdery/flakey mouthfeel covers both tongue and mouth... Strange and pretty nasty! Aftertaste is alcoholic, warmth and a hint of marzepin.
No carbo, dry powdery and sticky flakey chalky mouthfeel, medium body and a watery powdery texture. Wow, didnt expect this to be this nasty. Sorry guys for bringing this along and sharing this with you... Wont do it again!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle @ zzt. Aroma is salty anise, some alcohol and something unplaceable. Flavour is milky cream and anise. Meh.

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT VI. Hmm...this is really weird...it looks like glue...no head...aroma has sweetness and weirdness...cant describe the taste at all...very weird and sweet. Fun to taste once but no, I dont think Ill drink this more often.
Bottle @ ZZT VI thx to countbeer. Opaque white, no head. Smells glue, alcohol. Tastes sweet, rice.. Hard to describe this. Not a big fan of it. Thick body, silky, no carbo.

Bottle @ Home, courtesy af Henriksoegaard. Pours unclear milk coloured, some sediments. Aroma of rice, alcohol, piant thinner. Flavor of rice, alcohol, some sweet fruit, little paint thinner. Medium body, chalky mouthfeel. Looks, smells and tastes totally awfull. 070112
Belle bouteille de 300ml. Liquide blanc comme du lait. Il y a des pommes vertes et des poires aux nez comme en bouche. Cest facile et agréable. Un Nigori classique à boire bien froid.

Sweet marshmallow and coconut milk nose. Opaque jizzy appearance. Sweet koji, coconut, and kiwi flavor. Powdery texture, medium body, little alcohol detected. Sweet, yet balanced.  Nice nuances. Surprisingly good.

First sake! Tried to pick the best the store had... I poured in to a square shot glass, figured that was a hybrid of traditional glassware. Aroma is tropical fruity. Very cloudy milk color. Flavor is also tropical fruit. Palate is chalky. Overall not bad for my first sake, and will enjoy again the next time I have sushi.
Bottle from Japan-center London. Milky cloudy colour. Unpleasent. Light almond aroma and flavor. Average finish. Watery palate. Not good.

Nice bottle. Sake in the bottle, not so nice. White coloured and fully unclear. Has some sediments. Aroma of old rotten wood, faint pear. Flavor is moderate sweet, unpleasent. Odd sticky texture, bad. Flat.
Unclear milky white. Aroma is sweet, cooked rice and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Its like having chalk in your mouth. 140412
light sweet rice,white color,murky,light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, funny sake.
Light fruity apple sauce aroma. Milky water color. Mild sweet flavor with a light tart finish.

Bottle (shaken, not stirred).

No head (still).
Body is opaque white.

Aroma is notes of rice milk, diluted dairy milk, mold, alcohol.

Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic.
Finish is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, watery/gritty texture, no carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic, moderately astringent.

Clunky aroma with the expected fermented milk notes and little else.  Sugary sweet with barely enough acidity to balance.  Unpleasant mouthfeel, very gritty and astringent.  Not enjoyable.

Contents were settled in the bottle, After agitation, it pours opaque milky white with no head. Aroma of pears, alcohol. Slightly warming taste with pears, spice and rice. This is my first Saké rating, and my first try of the Nigori style.

Bottle from Kyle. Served with the provided gold leaf. Pours a milky white colour. Pineapple and coconut aroma and flavour. Chalky Gaviscon like mouth-feel with lingering Marmite yeast and pineapple. Look at the gold leaf!

THOUGHTS: My first sake. Interesting. I think Ill try some others. I thought the nigori style would be an interesting style to try. It was but Id also like to see how different all the styles are.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured an opaque, slightly off-white with non head and the only lacing was that of grit. The aroma was light tropical fruit, a little flowery notes, sort of coconut, rice milk and regular milk. The initial flavor was light to moderately sweet and lightly acidic; while the finish was moderate to heavily sweet and lightly acidic with an average duration. There was light fruit like pineapple and peach, rice milk. a sort of coconut, and sort of piña colada, alcohol and chalk. The medium body was sort of creamy and oily and gritty with no carbonation and a lightly alcoholic and rather chalky finish.
Ichiban Japanese storehouse.  Served cold. Milky white, non settling, mild alcohol, milk in the nose.  Very chalky palate mild alcohol.

06/05 0.300 l bottle courtesy of Doggythedog, thanks for sharing! It poured opaque white body with very small or no legs. Crumbs remain on the glass though. Strong rice, milk, fig wood, a bit artificial perfumey nose, didnt particularly enjoyed it. Flavor was very similar, too heavy and cloying. Alcohol is quite well hidden within all of it, shows mostly in its warming finish, which is long, sweet and makes me throw up. I can appreciate the style, but this was too much for me.
Milky white of color. An aroma of milk, spice and alcohol. An aroma of appels, spice and weak sour notes.

Bottle, like the one in the pic, found at a Thai (!!) store in Leuven, Belgium (?!), shared with the Croatian crew. Looks like soymilk. Dry nose, like slightly fake banana, or banana shake maybe, but dry. Some rice too. Powdery mouthfeel, sweet taste. Some rice, milky, some banana. Interesting and I liked it!

Bottle, courtesy of fonefan. Milky-white, lumpy body. The has a pleasant touch of rice and fruits, quite weak. Sweet in the mouth, rice-ish and quite fruity. Medium body, the mouth is covered with small rice bits. Tasteful, but not very pleasant to drink. Nigori is nice, but this ones too lumpy. 110129
Really good Nigori, creamy and full of texture. Lost a few points because of the low alcohol content.
Ugly, milky color. Aroma and flavor are rice and almonds. Gritty texture that just doesnt agree with me. I just dont get nigori sakes and this one did nothing to change my mind.

Bottle 250ml @ fonefan
Pours milky white. Aroma has notes of rice and almonds Taste is medium sweet. Texture is thick with lumps.
Bottle @ FOneFan. Mild white with no head. Flavour is rice, alcohol, grainy and dry.
Bottle at fonefan tasting. No head. Color is milky white. Aroma and taste are rice, alcohol and has a dry finish. Quite odd.
Bottle @ Friday Night Ulfborg Thing. Thanks to J&C. Pours milky and muddy white. Shiitt. Rice, alcohol and coconut.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a cloudy and opaque milky white. Sweet rice aroma. Mouthfeel is strangely grainy sticky, the tiny particles can clearly be felt. Sweet and a little perfumy rice notes. Interesting and not too bad. 151010

Bottle 300ml. @ post De Molen we want to goto bed Sake Tasting.ABV. 10.8%. Murky cream white color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to heavy rice, glue, rice water. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, sweet rice, alcohol, alcohol burn - warm finish. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamy and gritty, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20100925]

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 bottle at post De Molen we want to goto bed Sake tasting ... ok unfiltered ones are just weird ... i kind of like... but its kind of odd ... and the funny coating it leaves in mouth is freaky ... very milky creamy coloured ... very mellow light rice nose ... light rice ... carnation milk ... thick slightly gritty body ... some coconut... like i say i like but ...

bottle at home ... thanks to benjii and sevare i think this might be a different sake dutyfree shop limited edition...see twitter photo of 4th nov 2011 ...clowdy white .. with added gold leaf ... soft floral pineapple rice ...little anniseed nose ... sweet front .. light rice ... powery calkyness ...  3.8 ... you know this one is growing on me ... especaly as i steal more from the bottle 4.0

Non fat milky white color. Stinky garbage disposal aroma. Gritty viscous  coconut milk mouthfeel. Very nice grainy white rice, sugar sweet lactose flavors with earthy tropical fruits. Dank smell, great taste, hold your nose.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle- LCBO vintages, store 575. Cloudy, murky pour, like milk. Nose of cream of wheat, rice, sour cream, a bit grassy and floral. Fruity, somewhat sweet, milky, lactic, with rice. Somewhat coarse, almost gritty. Good.

(300 ml bottle from Hallowell Seafood) Served lightly chilled and shaken...Eeek, kind of nasty...Thick, slightly pinkish-yellow, grayish-white body. Aroma of milk, rice and paste. Mouthfeel fairly thick and grainy/husky, pasty-chalky. A thick, lasting white residue is leave behind for lacing. Flavor of milk, paste, solvent, rice and alcohol. Sweet and pasty. Lingering sweet pasty-chalk aftertaste. Not a good nigori.
Bottle at ØLbaren - Thanks ???. Milkey - no head. Milkey, coconut, minerals, rice, sweetness, white sugar, light alcoholic, light wooden notes. OK.

Botella bought in Yanai City, Yamaguchi. Pours a cloudy thin milky colur. Fruity sweet rice aroma, bit of coconut. Good filling dusty mouthfeel. Sweet,fruity, rice, coconut flavour with alcohol. Tasty Nigori indeed.
30 cL bottle, courtesy of faeroeviking. Pours murky/milky white head. Aroma is light phenolic, alcohol and light wooden. Dusty, smooth fruity and sweet. Lingering fruity and sweet finish.
White with no head. Sweet aroma with fruity, tart berries and honey notes. Weird flavour with something like coconut, fruits, rice and milk. Finished with warming alcohol.

mild colored, small white film head.
fruity in the aroma, banana, spritty.
flavor is rice, milky, coconut milky, faint banana, fruits, nice fllavor.
Bottled. Hot looking thin spunk appearance. Awesome legs. Green bananas in the aroma and in the flavour. Soft and creamy with nice sediment covering your tongue after swallowing. Satisfying.
Bottle. Pours thick and pulpy. Sweet banana in the nose. Flavor is a sweet banana, coconut, and rice. Its OK, but not flavorful enough.

300ML bottle.  Pours a pulpy milk white and is really clingy.  Taste is of rice, alcohol, fruit and banana.  Has nice pulpy body and has some fruit sweetness to it.  Easy to drink, enjoyable and refreshing.

Appearance: Consistency of Coconut Milk.

Aroma: Banana notes dominate.  Bubblegum.  Peach.

Taste: Here too banana is the leading element and like the aroma it comes across as very sweet to the point of being candy like.  Bubblegum and sweet, ripe, fruity yeasts play a roll too. 

Palate: Very sweet but not cloying.  Rich, sticky, thick, and powdery.  Healthy feeling, like Im drinking a nutrashake.  

Drinkability: Through the roof.  This is exceptionally approachable and makes for a great introduction to Nigori or Sake in general for that matter.  A very pleasurable sake especially for folks on a budget.
Somewhat surprized by this one. Very fruity with banana and coconut flavours that almost burst out at you. Sweet, but not cloying.  I like it!

300 ml bottle from City Market in Burlington, VT (February 2008), served chilled and shaken from a White Winter Winery glass.  Milky-cloudy/opaque, with just a hint of froth as its poured, thin white legs in the glass as it recedes.....sweet, ricey-coconut aroma, fairly simple with no hint of alcohol....the body is thick, lightly warming/alcoholic, moderately sweet with some hints of bitterness towards the finish, light toasted/burnt almond character, milky-thick at the finish....theres a little too much "grit" in this one, and its a little rough and hard on the finish, but on the whole its pretty enjoyable and less sweet and cloying than many; somewhat better than I expected.

300ml bottle poured into a beer festival sample glass that is as close to a Guinomi as I could find.  First of all I have very little experience with any kind of sake.  I happened upon two cases of this be chance.  GNS looks like coconut milk.  It has a decidedly alcohol nose along with buttermilk (yes I did pick that up after reading other ratings).  As a matter of fact Ill jump two feet into bu11zeyes description of almonds and possible pears as well.  The palate is very gritty and thick like some sort of ice cream malt.  The flavor has definite vanilla, canned peach juice, coconut and furry leaf flavor.  I hope that as I get more experience with sake I hope that this is a pretty good example.  I like this.
(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy grayish white milky liquid.  Aroma of buttermilk, almond, and pear.  Flavor of buttermilk, watermelon, and brown rice.

300ml bottle sample.  Pours like coconut milk.  Lots of sweet fruit aroma, maybe the slightest bit confectionery.  Great mouthfeel with a fruitful body that matches up with the nose.  Mostly rice and alcohol on the finish.  I agree with the sentiment that this one is a lot more drinkable than it looks.

300ml green bottle.  After shaking thoroughly, it pours a creamywhite spunk looking specimen. Very thick and opaque, solid white. Has a pearl like glow on the surface,  metallic looking  Aroma:  melon, pinapple, coconut (pina colata)  apples and pears, yeast.  Flavor: Pinot Gris, pinapple, alcohol.  Very gritty mouthfeel is obvious  A little too chalky.  A quick hitter!

Very milky it cannot be shaken too much. Even with a good amount of shaking it still gets much better toward the bottom of the bottle. It tastes of melon and rice. They really meant it when they said roughly filtered because its gritty, real gritty.

Spinnakers Store, VictoriaPours thick, white...milky and looking like guava juice or soghum beer.  Nigori is fun to look at.  Aroma of bubblegum, pear, peach, yeast.  Smooth palate is sweet, sugary rice with light fruit notes and a hint of tartness late.  With nigiri it demonstrates a lively, fruity, milky character.  Scores bonus points for drinkability...for something that doesnt look terribly approachable it sure tastes approachable.

A collection of haikus/

Had with a good friend,
We chose something that looked fun,
Frosted, green, and small.  /

Filled with mist and clouds,
It coats the glass in debris,
Could this be the yeast?  /

Its cold; smell is faint,
Pear, lactose, melon and rice,
Smells like a ginjo.  /

Fruity on the tongue,
But theres something very strange,
Tastes like Kaopectate!  /

Could be heresy,
Drinking this milky sake,
I should drink junmai.

300mL Bottle: Thick milky white, nose of starch, fart, butter, paper and alcohol. The mouthfeel is minerally, chalky, thick, rich with proteins. The flavor is decent, a bit light in alcohol than the taste would give you, but were talking 2/3rds the usual ABV and with a horrible sewage aroma. Meh, sweet, chalky. Bad. I cant stand this crap.

Without a doubt, unfiltered. Chalky white with a light pink hue, or maybe that is just some ambient color being picked up. Not sure. Chalks up the side of the glass. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Hints of alcohol but not as prominent as with other sakes that I have had. The flavor is fruity and alcoholic. A sourness comes in a shakes things up a bit. The mouthfeel is interesting. Chalky, not thick though. In the end I am not a big fan and am too ignorant to establish this in the pantheons of sake as either good or bad.

Pours a coconut milky color that coats the glass with particles when agitated.  Aroma of melon, alcohol, some rice.  Taste is much the same, somewhat sweet with a dry finish.  Mouthfeel is somewhat chalky--though it doesnt taste chalky--from the low filtration and kinda watery.  Nothing really spectacular with this guy.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Interesting look, as the waiter shook this at the table. Shape shifting pour. Aroma was muted, with tropical fruit being at the fore. Flavor was good with muskmelon, rice, with a hard liquor burn.

Served chilled and shaken.  Milky white, leaves a chalky residue on the sides of the glass.  Aroma of canteloupe, coconut, and rice.  Thick chalky mouthfeel.  Green grape sourness, rice, and alcohol flavor.  Very interesting, and very a very different experience.  I would drink this again.

300mL green screwtop bottle.  Poured into a small glass its milky white, similar in appearance to a chalky antacid - it looks a bit thick, grainy almost, like a watery rice or potato mash.  Semi-sweet aroma of some grapes, creamy oats and milk.  Moderately sharp alcohol in the nose as well.  Coats the mouth with a chalky, almost gritty semi-thick residue, although the body remains quite thin.  Its sweet, moderately harsh, somewhat milky but mostly chalky.  Not that bad actually, I like how the sweetness and the sour chalkyness are competing.

This is my most interesting sake experience to date.  After shaking the chilled bottle as instructed, I poured out a thick, milky brew that heavily coated the sides of the glass.  The aroma was rice, alcohol, and a melon-ish scent.  The palate was thick and grainy with the consistency of Kaopectate.  It tasted better than that.  Rice, alcohol, milk, maybe a hint of citrus zest.  It coated the mouth heavily with a chalky substance.  I enjoyed the experience, but doubt Ill have this again soon.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>

Bottle.  Rice alcohol aroma primarily - hints of cream and mint.   Watery milk appearance - looks like a melted pina colada.  Moderate rice, soy sauce and alcohol flavors primarily - slight hint of lemon and a creamy finish.  Has a fine gritty consistency.   Nice but very different.
